TFQ.questionText: The human heart has four chambers.
Vaccines can cause autism in children.
Blood type is determined by the presence or absence of certain antigens on the surface of red blood cells.
Antibiotics are effective against viral infections.
All types of cancer are treatable if caught early enough.
The human body has 206 bones.
Allergies are caused by an overactive immune response.
The liver is responsible for filtering toxins from the blood.
Type 2 diabetes is caused by a lack of insulin in the body.
The human body can survive without water for up to a week.
Antibodies are proteins that are produced by the immune system in response to a pathogen.
Red blood cells are the only type of blood cell that can carry oxygen.
The human brain stops developing after adolescence.
Cancer is caused by a genetic mutation in cells.
The lymphatic system is responsible for transporting nutrients throughout the body.
White blood cells are responsible for fighting off infections.
The human body is made up of 70% water.
The immune system can remember and recognize previously encountered pathogens.
The pancreas is responsible for producing and secreting digestive enzymes.
Antibiotics are only effective against bacterial infections.
People who are left-handed have a higher risk of developing mental illness.
Children who grow up in bilingual households have delayed language development compared to monolingual children.
Emotional intelligence is a fixed trait that cannot be developed over time.
Human beings are the only species capable of experiencing emotions.
Personality traits are mostly determined by genetics and cannot be changed.
The age at which children learn to walk is determined solely by genetic factors.
The concept of the "self" is universal across all cultures.
Attachment styles developed in childhood do not affect adult relationships.
The development of moral reasoning in children is universal across all cultures.
The idea of the "midlife crisis" is supported by scientific evidence.
IQ tests are a reliable measure of intelligence across all cultures.
People who are introverted are more likely to develop anxiety disorders.
Culture has no effect on the way people perceive and experience emotions.
People who experience traumatic events will inevitably develop post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).
The concept of mental illness is universal across all cultures.
Human beings are naturally inclined to be selfish and competitive.
Gender roles are determined solely by biology and genetics.
People who are bilingual are more prone to cognitive decline in old age.
The phenomenon of culture shock is experienced only by people who travel to foreign countries.
The idea that people use only 10% of their brain is a scientific fact.
